_exec_summary.SummaryText:
LCY Elastomers LP owns and operates a facility at 4803 Decker Drive, Baytown, Texas, which began operations in 1992 to manufacture synthetic rubber from a polymerization process utilizing styrene monomer and either 1,3-butadiene in a cyclohexane solvent solution. This facility was previously owned by ENI and operated under the names, EniChem Elastomers Americas Inc., EniChem Americas Inc., and Polimeri Europa.



The RMP regulated flammable materials at this facility is 1,3-butadiene. One toxic material, dimethyldichlorosilane is maintained at this location above the threshold limit.



The process is a continuous batch reaction in which a styrene butadiene co-block polymer is produced. After the rubber is formed, the solvent is steam stripped and the polymerized material is carried to the finishing and packaging section in a water slurry. After the rubber undergoes a drying and cooling process, it is packaged in boxes, bags, or sacks. On site storage space is adequate for inventory and shipping of all product.



LCY Elastomers LP has not had an accidental release since the plant began operation in 1992.



Along with the RMP regulations, LCY Elastomers LP is also regulated by OSHA's Process Safety Management regulations. This regulation duplicates many of the requirements promulgated by the RMP rule. LCY Elastomers LP risk management program involves the use of state of the art process control systems and equipment in the safest working condition. Personnel are also trained on emergency response procedures for handling situations that could present a hazard to equipment or personnel within the facility or outside the boundaries of company property. Procedures are reviewed on an annual basis and personnel receive both on-site and off-site training to prepare for incidents that presents a hazard. LCY Elastomers LP participates in the Baytown Community Advisory Panel, a group comprised of Baytown citizens and industry management. This group meets monthly to allow cit

izens to share their concerns and hear from industry representatives what processes are in place to ensure the safety of the Baytown community. LCY also communicates to Baytown emergency management officials the potential hazards that exist at this facility and the risk management procedures that are in place should a situation occur. LCY Elastomers LP Emergency Response Teams participate in annual exercises to test procedures and equipment to ensure their readiness and capability to mitigate incidents.
